modelConfiguration.description: A model configuration is the set of values of the parameters and initial values of the state variables of the model at the start of a given scenario, usually at timestep zero or one (depending on the choice of the start index).

modelId.description: The ID of the model, used in the model AMR.

name.description: A very concise name describing the scenario for which this configuration represents; for example, the configuration of a epidemiological model representing the disease state of the population at the onset of a disease outbreak.

description.description: A description of the scenario represented by the given model configuration; usually no more than one or two sentences.

inferredParameterList.description: A list of probability distributions for every parameter of the model at the start of the scenario; they can be posterior probability distributions derived from data using, for example, Bayesian statistics or maximum likelihood estimation.

initialSemanticList.description: The initial condition of the model; a list of value for every state variable at the start of the simulation or scenario, usually timestep zero or one (depending on the choice of the starting index).

items.description: The initial condition of a given state variable of the model; a starting value (number or mathematical expression) of this state variable.

expression.description: A mathematical representation of the initial condition of this state variable, written in SymPy; for example, the initial condition of the state variable 'proportion of infected individuals' can be a percentage of the total population.

expressionMathml.description: A MathML equivalent of the Sympy expression for the initial condition of this state variable.

source.description: A citation or description of the reference resource in which the initial condition of this state variable is defined.

target.description: The target is the state variable to which this initial condition is assigned

observableSemanticList.description: A list of observables defined for the model.

items.description: An observable is a real-valued function of the parameters and state variables of the model; it usually reprsents a measurable property that can be derived from the state of the model; examples include the total population of individuals (sum of all the state variables in a compartmental model) and the basic reproduction number (a ratio of the transmission rate and the recovery rate).

expression.description: A mathematical representation of the observable function, written in SymPy.

expressionMathml.description: A MathML equivalent of the Sympy expression for the observable.

referenceId.description: A unique and short name for the observable; for example, 'N' for the total population and 'R0' for the basic reproduction number.

source.description: A citation or description of the reference resource in which the observable is defined.

parameterSemanticList.description: A list of value for every parameter of the model at the start of the scenario.

items.description: The initial value of a given parameter of the model; it can be a probability distribution representing measurement uncertainty or a real number (a point estimate).

distribution.description: A 'uniform' probability distribution representing the measurement uncertainty or best range estimate of the model parameter.

parameters.description: Parameters of the probability distribution assigned to the given model parameter.

value.description: The initial value of the given parameter; it can be a point estimate or median of the uniform probability distribution; it must be a real number.

minimum.description: The lower bound parameter of the uniform probability distribution; it must be a real number.

maximum.description: The upper bound parameter of the uniform probability distribution; it must be a real number.

type.description: The name of the probability distribution; this should be the unique ID used by the ProbOnto ontology; for example, StandardUniform1 and StandardNormal1.

referenceId.description: The ID used to reference the parameter in the model AMR.

source.description: A citation or description of the reference resource in which the value of this model parameter is defined.
